job_description: Family medicine physicians provide comprehensive healthcare for individuals and families across all ages, genders, and diseases. They focus on preventive care, routine checkups, diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic illnesses, health risk assessments, and personalized health advice. They serve as the first point of contact in the healthcare system and coordinate care with specialists when needed.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a 3-year family medicine residency program, board certification through the American Board of Family Medicine (ABFM) or equivalent in other countries, and state medical license.
skills_required: Broad medical knowledge across all age groups
Ability to build long-term patient relationships
education_path: Optional fellowship in areas like sports medicine, geriatrics, or obstetrics (1-2 years)
related_exams: American Board of Family Medicine Certification Exam
salary_range: $200,000 - $280,000 annually, varying by location, experience, and practice type

job_description: Internists specialize in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of adult diseases. They manage complex and chronic illnesses, focusing on non-surgical treatment of diseases affecting the internal organs. Internists often serve as primary care physicians for adults but also work in hospital settings caring for inpatients with various medical conditions.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a 3-year internal medicine residency program, board certification through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Ability to manage multiple chronic conditions
related_exams: American Board of Internal Medicine Certification Exam
Subspecialty board certification exams if applicable
salary_range: $220,000 - $300,000 annually, with hospitalists often earning at the higher end of the range

job_description: Pediatricians specialize in the physical, emotional, and social health of children from birth to young adulthood. They provide preventive health services, diagnose and treat acute and chronic diseases, monitor developmental milestones, administer vaccinations, and offer guidance on children's health, growth, nutrition, and safety issues.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a 3-year pediatric residency program, board certification through the American Board of Pediatrics (ABP) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Knowledge of childhood diseases and conditions
related_exams: American Board of Pediatrics Certification Exam
Pediatric subspecialty board certifications if applicable
salary_range: $180,000 - $250,000 annually, with subspecialists earning more

job_description: OB/GYNs specialize in women's reproductive health, providing care during pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum periods (obstetrics) as well as diagnosing and treating conditions of the female reproductive system (gynecology). They perform surgeries, deliver babies, conduct preventive screenings, and manage reproductive health issues across a woman's lifespan.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a 4-year OB/GYN residency program, board certification through the American Board of Obstetrics and Gynecology (ABOG) or equivalent, and state medical license.
related_exams: American Board of Obstetrics and Gynecology Written and Oral Exams
career_growth: Subspecialist (maternal-fetal medicine, reproductive endocrinology, gynecologic oncology, urogynecology)
salary_range: $280,000 - $400,000 annually, with subspecialists earning at the higher end

job_description: General surgeons perform operations involving the abdomen, breast, peripheral vasculature, skin, and neck. They diagnose and treat a wide range of conditions requiring surgical intervention, manage pre and post-operative care, perform emergency surgeries, and collaborate with other specialists for complex cases. Common procedures include appendectomies, hernia repairs, gallbladder removals, and breast surgeries.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a 5-year general surgery residency program, board certification through the American Board of Surgery (ABS) or equivalent, and state medical license.
related_exams: American Board of Surgery Qualifying (written) and Certifying (oral) Exams
career_growth: General surgeon in hospital or private practice
salary_range: $350,000 - $500,000 annually, depending on location, experience, and subspecialty

job_description: Cardiologists diagnose and treat heart diseases and conditions of the cardiovascular system. They interpret diagnostic tests like ECGs, echocardiograms, and cardiac catheterizations, manage conditions such as coronary artery disease, heart failure, and arrhythmias, and provide preventive care for patients at risk of heart disease. They perform procedures like cardiac catheterization and may specialize further in interventional cardiology, electrophysiology, or heart failure.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), cardiology fellowship (3 years), board certification in internal medicine and cardiovascular disease through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional advanced fellowship (1-2 years) in interventional cardiology, electrophysiology, etc.
salary_range: $450,000 - $650,000+ annually, with interventional cardiologists often at the higher end

job_description: Dermatologists diagnose and treat conditions affecting the skin, hair, nails, and mucous membranes. They manage diseases like acne, psoriasis, eczema, and skin cancer, perform skin biopsies and surgical procedures, conduct skin cancer screenings, and may provide cosmetic services. They work with patients of all ages and often collaborate with other specialists for conditions with skin manifestations.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a dermatology residency (4 years, often including 1 year of internal medicine), board certification through the American Board of Dermatology (ABD) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Knowledge of systemic diseases with skin manifestations
education_path: Dermatology residency (4 years, often including preliminary year)
Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in Mohs surgery, pediatric dermatology, dermatopathology, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Dermatology Certification Exam
salary_range: $350,000 - $600,000+ annually, with cosmetic dermatologists often earning more from elective procedures

job_description: Psychiatrists diagnose, treat, and prevent mental, emotional, and behavioral disorders. They assess both the mental and physical aspects of psychological problems, prescribe medications, provide psychotherapy, and determine treatment plans. They may specialize in areas like child and adolescent psychiatry, addiction psychiatry, geriatric psychiatry, or forensic psychiatry.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a psychiatry residency (4 years), board certification through the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology (ABPN) or equivalent, and state medical license.
related_exams: American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology Certification Exam
salary_range: $250,000 - $350,000 annually, with variation based on location and subspecialty

job_description: Orthopedic surgeons diagnose and treat conditions affecting the musculoskeletal system, including bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, muscles, and nerves. They perform surgeries such as joint replacements, fracture repairs, spine surgeries, and arthroscopic procedures. They treat sports injuries, degenerative conditions, trauma, and congenital disorders, and often work with physical therapists for rehabilitation.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of an orthopedic surgery residency (5 years), board certification through the American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery (ABOS) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in spine, sports medicine, hand, joint replacement, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery Part I (written) and Part II (oral) Exams
career_growth: Subspecialist (sports medicine, spine, hand, joint replacement, etc.)
salary_range: $450,000 - $700,000+ annually, one of the highest-paid medical specialties

job_description: Neurologists diagnose and treat disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, peripheral nerves, and muscles. They manage conditions such as stroke, epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, headaches, and neuromuscular disorders. They perform specialized examinations, interpret diagnostic tests like EEGs and EMGs, and develop treatment plans for neurological conditions.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a neurology residency (4 years, typically including 1 year of internal medicine), board certification through the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology (ABPN) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Neurology residency (4 years, including preliminary year)
Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in areas like epilepsy, movement disorders, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology Certification Exam in Neurology
salary_range: $280,000 - $380,000 annually, with subspecialists often earning more

job_description: Oncologists specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of cancer. They develop and administer treatment plans that may include chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and targeted therapies. They monitor treatment response, manage side effects, coordinate with surgeons and radiation oncologists, conduct clinical trials, and provide supportive care throughout the cancer journey, including end-of-life care when needed.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), medical oncology fellowship (3 years), board certification in internal medicine and medical oncology through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Knowledge of rapidly evolving cancer therapies
education_path: Optional additional fellowship (1-2 years) in areas like hematology
salary_range: $350,000 - $450,000 annually, with variation based on location and subspecialty

job_description: Anesthesiologists administer anesthetics and monitor patients during surgical procedures to ensure safety and comfort. They develop anesthetic plans based on patient health status, manage pain control, maintain vital functions during surgery, handle emergency situations, and oversee post-operative recovery. They may specialize in areas like pediatric anesthesia, cardiac anesthesia, obstetric anesthesia, or pain management.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of anesthesiology residency (4 years, including internship year), board certification through the American Board of Anesthesiology (ABA) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1 year) in critical care, pain management, pediatric anesthesia, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Anesthesiology Basic and Advanced Examinations
salary_range: $350,000 - $550,000 annually, depending on practice setting and location

job_description: Radiologists interpret medical images such as X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, ultrasounds, and nuclear medicine studies to diagnose and treat diseases. They perform image-guided procedures like biopsies and fluid drainages, consult with other physicians about findings, and may specialize in areas like neuroradiology, interventional radiology, or musculoskeletal imaging. They play a crucial role in disease detection and treatment planning.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of a diagnostic radiology residency (5 years, including internship year), board certification through the American Board of Radiology (ABR) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Diagnostic radiology residency (5 years, including internship)
Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in subspecialty areas
related_exams: American Board of Radiology Core and Certifying Exams
salary_range: $350,000 - $500,000 annually, with interventional radiologists often earning more

job_description: Emergency medicine physicians provide immediate recognition, evaluation, care, and stabilization for patients with acute illnesses and injuries in emergency department settings. They manage a wide spectrum of conditions from minor injuries to life-threatening emergencies, perform procedures like intubation and central line placement, coordinate care with specialists, and make rapid disposition decisions.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of an emergency medicine residency (3-4 years), board certification through the American Board of Emergency Medicine (ABEM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in critical care, toxicology, sports medicine, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Emergency Medicine Written and Oral Certification Exams
salary_range: $300,000 - $400,000 annually, often with shift-based compensation models

job_description: Pediatric subspecialists focus on diagnosing and treating specific health conditions in infants, children, and adolescents. These may include pediatric cardiologists, neurologists, endocrinologists, gastroenterologists, hematologist-oncologists, pulmonologists, and others. They manage complex and rare childhood diseases requiring specialized expertise and often work in children's hospitals or academic medical centers.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of pediatric residency (3 years), subspecialty fellowship (2-3 years), board certification in pediatrics and the subspecialty through the American Board of Pediatrics (ABP) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Complex disease management in growing patients
related_exams: American Board of Pediatrics Certification Exam
salary_range: $240,000 - $400,000+ annually, varying widely by subspecialty and location

job_description: Neurosurgeons diagnose and surgically treat disorders of the central and peripheral nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. They perform surgeries for conditions such as brain tumors, spine disorders, traumatic brain injuries, vascular anomalies, epilepsy, and congenital abnormalities. They use highly specialized techniques including microsurgery, endoscopy, and stereotactic surgery.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of neurological surgery residency (7 years), board certification through the American Board of Neurological Surgery (ABNS) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Ability to work under extreme pressure
Decision-making with narrow margins of error
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in subspecialty areas
related_exams: American Board of Neurological Surgery Primary and Oral Board Exams
salary_range: $600,000 - $800,000+ annually, one of the highest-paid medical specialties

job_description: Pathologists study the causes and effects of diseases by examining body tissues, fluids, and organs. They analyze biopsies, surgical specimens, and autopsy findings to provide diagnoses. They interpret laboratory tests, guide treatment decisions, consult with other physicians, and may specialize in areas like anatomic pathology, clinical pathology, forensic pathology, or specific organ systems. They play a crucial role in cancer diagnosis and classification.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of pathology residency (3-4 years), board certification through the American Board of Pathology (ABP) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in subspecialty areas
related_exams: American Board of Pathology Anatomic and/or Clinical Pathology Exams
salary_range: $250,000 - $400,000 annually, varying by subspecialty and practice setting

job_description: Urologists diagnose and treat disorders of the urinary tract in both men and women, and the reproductive system in men. They manage conditions such as urinary tract infections, kidney stones, prostate diseases, male infertility, erectile dysfunction, and urologic cancers. They perform surgeries including prostatectomies, kidney surgeries, and bladder procedures, and increasingly use minimally invasive and robotic techniques.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of urology residency (5 years, including general surgery training), board certification through the American Board of Urology (ABU) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Urology residency (5 years, including general surgery time)
Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in areas like pediatric urology, oncology, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Urology Qualifying and Certifying Exams
salary_range: $380,000 - $500,000 annually, with higher earnings potential in private practice

job_description: Ophthalmologists are medical doctors who specialize in eye and vision care. They diagnose and treat eye diseases, perform eye surgeries, prescribe medications, and fit eyeglasses and contact lenses. They manage conditions such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, and perform procedures like LASIK, corneal transplants, and retinal surgeries.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of ophthalmology residency (3-4 years following internship), board certification through the American Board of Ophthalmology (ABO) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional fellowship (1-2 years) in cornea, retina, glaucoma, etc.
related_exams: American Board of Ophthalmology Written Qualifying and Oral Exams
salary_range: $300,000 - $500,000+ annually, with higher earnings for surgical subspecialists

job_description: Gastroenterologists diagnose and treat disorders of the digestive system, including the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestines, pancreas, gallbladder, and liver. They perform procedures such as endoscopies, colonoscopies, and ERCP. They manage conditions like inflammatory bowel disease, liver disease, reflux, peptic ulcers, and gastrointestinal cancers.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), gastroenterology fellowship (3 years), board certification in internal medicine and gastroenterology through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional advanced fellowship (1 year) in areas like advanced endoscopy, hepatology, etc.
salary_range: $380,000 - $500,000 annually, with higher earnings for those performing many procedures

job_description: Pulmonologists diagnose and treat diseases of the respiratory system, including the lungs, upper airways, thoracic cavity, and chest wall. They manage conditions such as asthma, COPD, pulmonary fibrosis, lung cancer, pulmonary hypertension, and sleep disorders. They perform procedures like bronchoscopy, thoracentesis, and pulmonary function testing, and may work in both outpatient and intensive care settings.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), pulmonary disease fellowship (2-3 years), often combined with critical care, board certification in internal medicine and pulmonary disease through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
education_path: Optional critical care fellowship (1-2 years) if not combined
related_exams: ABIM Critical Care Medicine Certification if applicable
salary_range: $300,000 - $400,000 annually, with critical care certified physicians often earning more

job_description: Rheumatologists diagnose and treat autoimmune diseases and disorders of the joints, muscles, and bones. They manage conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, gout, osteoarthritis, vasculitis, and systemic sclerosis. They specialize in non-surgical treatment of inflammatory conditions, interpret laboratory tests and imaging studies, and coordinate care with other specialists.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), rheumatology fellowship (2-3 years), board certification in internal medicine and rheumatology through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
salary_range: $240,000 - $300,000 annually, one of the more moderately paid specialties

job_description: Endocrinologists diagnose and treat disorders related to hormones and the endocrine system. They manage conditions such as diabetes, thyroid disorders, osteoporosis, pituitary disorders, adrenal diseases, metabolic disorders, and hormonal imbalances. They interpret specialized hormone tests, develop treatment plans, and provide ongoing management for often complex and chronic conditions.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), endocrinology fellowship (2-3 years), board certification in internal medicine and endocrinology through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
skills_required: Thyroid ultrasound and biopsy skills (in some cases)
education_path: Endocrinology, diabetes, and metabolism fellowship (2-3 years)
related_exams: ABIM Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism Certification
salary_range: $220,000 - $300,000 annually, moderately paid compared to procedure-heavy specialties

job_description: Nephrologists specialize in kidney care and treating diseases of the kidneys. They diagnose and manage conditions such as chronic kidney disease, kidney stones, glomerulonephritis, hypertension, electrolyte disorders, and kidney failure. They oversee dialysis treatment, prepare patients for kidney transplantation, interpret kidney function tests, and manage complex fluid and electrolyte disorders.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), nephrology fellowship (2-3 years), board certification in internal medicine and nephrology through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
salary_range: $260,000 - $360,000 annually, with variation based on dialysis center directorship

job_description: Infectious disease specialists diagnose and treat complex infections caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi, parasites, and other organisms. They manage conditions such as HIV/AIDS, COVID-19, tuberculosis, complicated pneumonias, osteomyelitis, endocarditis, and travel-related illnesses. They interpret microbiological data, develop antimicrobial treatment plans, advise on infection control, and often serve as hospital epidemiologists.
eligibility: MD or DO degree, completion of internal medicine residency (3 years), infectious disease fellowship (2-3 years), board certification in internal medicine and infectious disease through the American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) or equivalent, and state medical license.
companies_hiring: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
salary_range: $230,000 - $300,000 annually, one of the lower-paid medical specialties despite complexity
